sentences.english: A shower of filthy abuse came from his lips.
sentences.chinese: 一大堆污言穢語從他嘴裏吐出來。

sentences.english: Never use foul language in front of adults.
sentences.chinese: 請勿在大人面前使用污言穢語。

sentences.english: Pay attention to civilization and manners, not to say bawdry.
sentences.chinese: 講究文明禮貌，不污言穢語。

sentences.english: Strike at 3 mountain company at the same time still have a lot of corrupt character bawdry .
sentences.chinese: 同時砸向三嶺公司的還有許多污言穢語。

sentences.english: That young man flung out hard words against me.
sentences.chinese: 那位青年對我粗言穢語。

sentences.english: Or say any profanities or anything like that.
sentences.chinese: 或者說任何穢語或那類話。

definition: to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to start rumours and create trouble
sudden thrust (that catches the opponent off guard)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
